relations.target: metabolite=15135363-n (any substance involved in metabolism (either as a product of metabolism or as necessary for metabolism))

rubber=01132700-a (returned for lack of funds; \""a rubber check\""; \""a no-good check\"");00136062-v (coat or impregnate with rubber; \""rubberize fabric for rain coats\"");02738543-n (a waterproof overshoe that protects shoes from water or snow);03092620-n (contraceptive device consisting of a sheath of thin rubber or latex that is worn over the penis during intercourse);04123606-n (an eraser made of rubber (or of a synthetic material with properties similar to rubber); commonly mounted at one end of a pencil);07480405-n (a contest consisting of a series of successive matches between the same sides; \""he won three out of five games to take the rubber\"");15030825-n (an elastic material obtained from the latex sap of trees (especially trees of the genera Hevea and Ficus) that can be vulcanized and finished into a variety of products);15031356-n (any of various synthetic elastic materials whose properties resemble natural rubber
latex=03651334-n (a water-base paint that has a latex binder);15030685-n (a milky exudate from certain plants that coagulates on exposure to air)
secretory=02805077-a (of or relating to or producing a secretion; \""a secretory cell\""

elongated=01436882-a (having notably more length than width; being long and slender; \""an elongate tail tapering to a point\""; \""the old man's gaunt and elongated frame\"");01437093-a (drawn out or made longer spatially; \""Picasso's elongated Don Quixote\""; \""lengthened skirts are fashionable this year\""; \""the extended airport runways can accommodate larger planes\""; \""a prolonged black line across the page\""

senses.definition: a type of elongated secretory cell found in the leaves and/or stems of plants that produce latex and rubber as secondary metabolites.
